definitions: having an appearance that is unpleasant or offensive to see
involving or showing morally reprehensible behavior that causes distress
examples: The ugly scar on his face made him self-conscious
That old building is ugly but has historical value
It was an ugly incident that damaged their reputation
The ugly truth about corruption shocked the community

definitions: of or relating to Palestine, its people, culture, or territories
examples: Palestinian artists showcased their work at the international gallery
The Palestinian delegation attended the peace conference yesterday

definitions: relating to government revenue, public money, taxes, or financial matters
examples: The fiscal year ends in June for many corporations
Congress debated the new fiscal policy for hours yesterday

definitions: having a level surface without raised areas or indentations
lacking emotion, enthusiasm, or energy in expression or delivery
fixed at one level without variation or fluctuation over time
absolute and unqualified in manner or expression without ambiguity
examples: The flat surface is perfect for rolling dough
We need a flat area to set up camp
Her voice was flat during the entire presentation
The actor's performance fell flat with the audience
They charge a flat rate regardless of usage
The company offers flat pricing for all customers
He gave a flat refusal to their proposal
That's a flat lie and everyone knows it

definitions: having or showing experience, knowledge, and good judgment in decisions
having great learning or knowledge accumulated through study and experience
examples: It was wise to save money for emergencies
She made a wise choice in accepting the offer
The wise professor shared insights from years of research
Ancient wise men studied the stars for centuries

definitions: produced or grown without using artificial chemicals or pesticides
developing naturally and gradually without being forced or contrived
relating to bodily organs or an organized physical structure
examples: She only buys organic vegetables from local farms
The restaurant serves organic, locally sourced ingredients daily
The protest movement had an organic growth over time
Their friendship developed in an organic, natural way
The doctor found no organic cause for her symptoms
Tests revealed organic damage to the liver tissue

definitions: showing a great deal of variety or differences among elements
examples: The university has a diverse student body from many countries
Our team benefits from diverse perspectives and backgrounds

definitions: relating to the ability to think and understand ideas
possessing a highly developed intellect and taste for academic pursuits
examples: Chess is an intellectual game requiring strategic thinking
The intellectual property rights protect creative works
She's an intellectual who reads philosophy for pleasure
The intellectual elite gathered for the annual symposium

definitions: firmly or closely fixed in place and difficult to move
having little space between things or little room to move
strictly controlled or enforced with little flexibility allowed
having a close bond or strong connection between people
examples: Make sure the lid is tight before shaking
The rope was pulled tight across the gap
These shoes are too tight for comfortable walking
The tight schedule left no room for delays
Security was tight at the international summit meeting
They run a tight ship with strict rules
We've been tight friends since elementary school
The tight-knit community supports each other always

definitions: complete and total without any doubt or reservation whatsoever
not qualified or diminished in any way; existing independently
examples: The dictator demanded absolute loyalty from his followers
She has absolute confidence in her team's abilities
The court ruled with absolute authority on the matter
In physics, absolute zero is the lowest possible temperature

definitions: belonging to or forming the outer surface or structure
coming or derived from a source outside the subject
examples: The external walls need a fresh coat of paint
Check the external temperature before going outside
The company hired external consultants for the project
External factors influenced the election results significantly

definitions: causing someone to feel mild astonishment or shock unexpectedly
examples: The test results were surprising to everyone involved
It's surprising how quickly children learn new languages

definitions: able to move or be moved freely and easily
relating to cellular phones or portable communication devices
examples: The mobile medical unit travels to rural areas
Elderly patients need mobile assistance devices for walking
Download our mobile app for convenient shopping anywhere
Mobile technology has revolutionized how we communicate daily

definitions: feeling or showing anxiety about actual or potential problems
examples: Parents were worried about their children's online safety
She looked worried when she heard the news

definitions: happening, done, or chosen without method or conscious decision
examples: The lottery uses random number selection for fairness
Police conducted random checks at the border crossing

definitions: in the state of sleep; not awake or conscious
examples: The baby fell asleep after drinking warm milk
Don't make noise; everyone is asleep upstairs

definitions: very unusual or remarkable in a way that inspires wonder
going beyond what is usual, regular, or customary in scope
examples: She has extraordinary talent for playing the violin
The rescue was an extraordinary feat of bravery
The board called an extraordinary meeting to discuss crisis
These circumstances require extraordinary measures to resolve properly

definitions: at or to a short distance away in space
close to happening or being achieved in time
examples: The grocery store is near our house downtown
Keep dangerous chemicals away from near food areas
We are near completing the construction project successfully
The near future holds many exciting possibilities

definitions: based on or following what is traditionally or generally accepted
examples: They chose a conventional wedding ceremony with traditional vows
Conventional wisdom says to save ten percent of income

definitions: located a short distance away in the surrounding area
examples: There's a pharmacy nearby if you need medicine
The nearby residents complained about the construction noise

definitions: including all or nearly all elements or aspects of something
examples: The report provides a comprehensive analysis of market trends
Students must pass a comprehensive exam before graduating

definitions: not likely to change or fail; firmly established
not likely to give way or overturn; firmly fixed
relating to a building for housing horses or livestock
examples: The patient's condition is stable after the surgery
They have a stable relationship built on trust
Make sure the ladder is stable before climbing up
The table isn't stable on this uneven floor
The stable boy feeds the horses every morning
She learned riding at the local stable facility

definitions: achieving maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort or expense
examples: The new system is more efficient than the old one
She's an efficient manager who gets things done quickly

definitions: gladly received or admitted with pleasure or approval
allowed or invited to do or take something freely
examples: You're always welcome at our home for dinner
The cool breeze was a welcome relief from heat
You're welcome to use my computer while I'm gone
Visitors are welcome to explore the garden freely

definitions: satisfying one's conception of what is perfect; most suitable
existing only in the imagination; desirable but not likely
examples: This location is ideal for our new restaurant
She's the ideal candidate for the leadership position
In an ideal world, there would be no poverty
His ideal solution ignored practical limitations completely

definitions: not firmly or tightly fixed in place; detached
not strict or exact in interpretation or enforcement
free from confinement or restraint; at large
examples: The screw came loose and needs tightening immediately
She prefers wearing loose clothing in summer
They have a loose interpretation of the rules
The movie is loosely based on true events
The dog got loose and ran through the neighborhood
There's a loose wire causing electrical problems

definitions: affected by alcohol to the extent of losing control
examples: The drunk driver was arrested at the checkpoint
He got drunk at the office holiday party

definitions: not present when expected or supposed to be
unable to be found or located despite searching
examples: Three students were missing from class this morning
The report is missing crucial data about costs
The missing child was found safe after two days
Police are searching for the missing jewelry items

definitions: having or showing a lack of common sense or judgment
playful and lighthearted in a harmless, amusing way
examples: It was silly to go out without an umbrella
Don't make silly mistakes on the easy questions
The children made silly faces at each other
We spent the afternoon telling silly jokes together

definitions: situated far from the main centers of population
having very little connection with or relationship to something
examples: They live in a remote village in the mountains
The cabin is too remote for internet service
There's only a remote chance of rain today
The two incidents seem remote from each other

definitions: worthy of attention as being extraordinary or exceptional in quality
examples: She made remarkable progress in learning the language quickly
The scientist made a remarkable discovery about DNA structure

definitions: happening or used daily as part of regular routine life
examples: These are my everyday shoes for walking to work
The museum displays everyday objects from ancient Rome

definitions: without clothes on the body; nude or bare
without the usual covering or protection on something
expressed openly without attempt to disguise or conceal
examples: The doctor asked him to remove his shirt for examination
Ancient Greek athletes competed naked in the Olympics
The naked branches looked stark against winter sky
Never touch naked electrical wires without protection
It was naked ambition that drove her success
The naked truth is sometimes hard to accept

definitions: enough to meet the needs of a situation or purpose
examples: We have sufficient funds to complete the project successfully
Two hours should be sufficient time for the exam

definitions: absolutely necessary or important for life or success
full of energy and life; animated and energetic
examples: Water is vital for human survival in the desert
It's vital that we arrive before the meeting starts
At ninety, she remains vital and active daily
The vital young athlete won three gold medals

definitions: evoking admiration through size, quality, or skill; grand and awesome
examples: The cathedral's impressive architecture attracts thousands of tourists yearly
She gave an impressive presentation that won the contract

definitions: extraordinarily good or attractive in an enthusiastic way
imaginative or fanciful; remote from reality or practicality
examples: The food at that restaurant is absolutely fantastic
We had a fantastic time at the beach yesterday
Dragons and unicorns are fantastic creatures from mythology
His fantastic tales entertained the children for hours

definitions: used to emphasize how small or insignificant something is
examples: The mere thought of spiders makes her nervous
He won the race by a mere two seconds

definitions: relating to or affecting the fundamental nature of something
advocating extreme political or social reform; revolutionary in nature
relating to the root of a number or quantity
examples: The company needs radical changes to survive competition
She proposed a radical solution to the problem
The radical group organized protests against the government
His radical views alienated moderate party members
Students learned to simplify radical expressions in algebra
The radical sign indicates a square root operation

definitions: causing fear or alarm; frightening in nature or appearance
examples: The scary movie kept the children awake all night
Walking alone at night can be scary sometimes

definitions: pleasing or appealing to look at; physically beautiful
having qualities that arouse interest or draw people
examples: She wore an attractive dress to the party
The house has attractive landscaping in the yard
The job offer was attractive because of the benefits
They made an attractive proposal to investors yesterday

definitions: in a state of peaceful happiness and satisfaction with circumstances
examples: She seems content with her life in the countryside
The cat looked content sleeping in the sunny window

definitions: shaped like a circle or sphere; curved without angles
constituting a complete series, set, or circuit of events
examples: The round table encourages equal participation in discussions
She wore round glasses that suited her face
Let's do another round of introductions for newcomers
The doctor makes rounds at the hospital daily

definitions: relating to chemistry or the interactions of substances
examples: The chemical reaction produced an unexpected gas
Workers must wear protection when handling chemical substances

definitions: exposed to the possibility of being attacked or harmed physically or emotionally
examples: Children are particularly vulnerable to online predators
The coastal town is vulnerable to hurricane damage

definitions: having four equal straight sides and four right angles
having or forming a right angle; perpendicular to something
having old-fashioned or boringly conventional attitudes or behaviors
examples: The square garden has equal sides of ten feet
Draw a square around the correct answer please
Make sure the frame is square with the wall
The carpenter checked that corners were perfectly square
Don't be such a square; try something new
His square attitudes seemed outdated to younger colleagues

definitions: concerning the writing, study, or appreciation of literature and books
examples: She won a literary award for her first novel
The literary magazine publishes poetry and short stories monthly

definitions: having supernatural powers to influence events mysteriously
wonderful and exciting in a way that seems supernatural
examples: The wizard used magic spells to defeat enemies
Children believe in magic during the holiday season
It was a magic moment when they won the championship
The sunset created a magic atmosphere on the beach

definitions: conforming to the law or to rules; valid and lawful
able to be defended with logic or justification; reasonable
examples: She has a legitimate claim to the inheritance
Only legitimate businesses can apply for this license
That's a legitimate concern about the project timeline
He raised legitimate questions about the research methodology

definitions: small in degree, amount, or importance; not considerable
thin and delicate in build or structure; not sturdy
examples: There's a slight chance of rain this afternoon
She noticed a slight improvement in his behavior
Her slight frame made her appear younger than her age
The slight breeze barely moved the curtain
